intro: Primula auricula subsp. tatriaca, commonly known as the Tatra primrose, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its flowers bloom in late spring, adding a splash of color to rocky slopes and meadows. The subspecies is notable for its adaptability to high-altitude conditions and its role in local ecosystems.
